description: From Middle English banysshen, from Old French banir (“to proclaim, ban, banish”) and Old English bannan, from Proto-Germanic *bannaną (“curse, forbid”). Compare to French bannir.

verbs.description: banish (third-person singular simple present banishes, present participle banishing, simple past and past participle banished)

entries.meaning: (heading) To send someone away and forbid that person from returning.
examples: He was banished from the kingdom for his crimes.

entries.meaning: To expel, especially from the mind.
